name: Kindergarten
full_description: Kindergarten activities focus on counting and number recognition, gradually introducing students to simple addition and subtraction operations. Throughout, on-screen manipulatives are used to help students visualize numbers and develop a conceptual understanding of the problems they are solving.
short_description: Counting, number recognition, simple addition and subtraction operations.

name: Grade 1
full_description: In first grade, student strengthen their understanding of operations and learn a variety of strategies (making 10, decomposing numbers leading to 10, etc.) to help them solve these operations. First grade also introduces place value, and addition and subtraction within 100. On-screen manipulatives help students visualize math problems and gain conceptual insights into how and why the various strategies work.
short_description: More advanced operations (making 10, decomposing numbers leading to 10), place value, addition and subtraction within 100.

name: Grade 2
full_description: In second grade, students continue their explorations of place value, and also begin to practice pre-multiplication skills (adding arrays). Activities in this grade place specific emphasis on mathematical strategies for solving problems involving 3-digit numbers and more than two 2-digit numbers. Second grade introduces 3D manipulatives that are helpful in understanding numbers over 100.
short_description: Place value, pre-multiplication skills, strategies for solving problems with multiple 2-digit and 3-digit numbers.
